subject: Career
title: Granovetter's Strength of Weak Ties
description: A 60-second lesson on Granovetter's Strength of Weak Ties.

hook.text: 83% of people who found jobs through contacts got them through acquaintances, not close friends.

buildup.text: Mark Granovetter's 1973 paper is one of the most cited in sociology: weak ties deliver more opportunities.

discovery.text: Close friends know the same people and information you do. Acquaintances bridge to new circles.

twist.text: This means casual contacts â€” old colleagues, conference acquaintances â€” are career gold mines.

climax.text: Maintain weak ties with occasional check-ins. A yearly message keeps the bridge alive.

punchline.text: Your next opportunity lives in your weakest ties.

quiz.question: What did Granovetter's research reveal about job finding?
